Be in a room with good lighting for the best experience.
Keep your Arduino board and components on a flat, stable surface.
Move closer to your components if not detecting.
Move away components if already detected.
Always disconnect power before making circuit changes.
Follow proper ESD (Electrostatic Discharge) precautions when handling components.
Check polarity of components before powering your circuit.
Keep liquids away from your Arduino and electronic components.
Use a multimeter to check connections if your circuit isn't working as expected.
Double-check your wiring against the schematic if something isn't working.
Restart the app if you encounter detection issues.
Ensure your Arduino IDE is up to date for compatibility.
